courses.description:
ASL-UE   91 American Sign Language I 
Fundamental principles of grammar & syntax, a basic vocabulary, & conventions of conversational discourse in the deaf community.  Emphasis is placed on developing the visual perception skills critical to understanding ASL.  Taught in a visual-manual method using no spoken English.

ASL-UE   92 American Sign Languge II 
Continues vocabulary development; introduces the student to intermediate grammatical & conversational techniques & aspects of deal culture & history.  Expressive skill development emphasizes smoothness & clarity in producing ASL.  Receptive skill development emphasizes understanding ASL and fingerspelling at a moderate rate.  Taught in a visual-manual method using no spoken English.

ASL-UE   93 American Sign Language III 
A continuation of ASL-UE 91 (American Sign Language I), ASL-UE 92 (American Sign Language II). Emphasis is on developing fluency in both expressive & receptive skills. Videotaping sessions also form an integral part of this course.

ASL-UE   94 American Sign Language IV 
A continuation of ASL-UE 91 (American Sign Language I), ASL-UE 92 (American Sign Language II), ASL-UE 93 (American Sign Language III). Emphasis is on developing fluency in both expressive & receptive skills. Videotaping sessions also form an integral part of this course.

ASL-UE 1000 Independent Study 
It should be noted that independent study requires a minimum of 45 hours of work per point. Independent study cannot be applied to established professional education sequence in teaching curricula. Each departmental program has established its own maximum credit allowance for independent study. This information may be obtained from a student's department. Prior to registering for independent study, each student should obtain an Independent Study Approval Form from the adviser.
ASL-UE 1091 Amer Sign Lang Level II
ASL-UE 1092 Amer Sign Lang Level II

Expressive skill development emphasizes smoothness & clarity in producing ASL.  Receptive skill development emphasizes understanding ASL & fingerspelling at a moderate rate.  Taught in a visual-manual method using no spoken English.

ASL-UE 9093 American Sign Language III 
A continuation of ASL-UE 91 American Sign Language I, ASL-UE 92 American Sign Language II. Emphasis is on developing fluency in both expressive & receptive skills. Videotaping sessions also form an integral part of this course.
